alert.note: Alert for Kane (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 27 at 6:05PM MDT until August 27 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN KANE COUNTY... At 605 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated earlier thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the basins feeding into Spooky and Peek-a-Boo Slot Canyons. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, normally dry washes, and slot canyon areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Spooky Slot Canyon, Peek-a-Boo Slot Canyon, and the upper portions of Coyote Gulch FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
